content:
Key Findings

  • The total spend analysed by AI DOGE is £1732.6M across 492,973 transactions.
  • The data coverage spans 6 financial years, from 2020/21 to 2025/26.
  • The analysis is based on published spending records from Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council, a unitary council in Lancashire, England.
  • The council's spending data is published under the Local Government Transparency Code, ensuring transparency and accountability.
  • The total number of transactions analysed is 492,973, providing a comprehensive overview of the council's spending habits.

Introduction to Blackburn's Spending

Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council's spending data has been analysed by AI DOGE, covering a period of 6 financial years from 2020/21 to 2025/26. The total spend analysed is £1732.6M, with 492,973 transactions recorded during this period. This data provides valuable insights into the council's spending habits and patterns.

The analysis of the spending data is crucial in ensuring transparency and accountability within the council. By examining the data, AI DOGE aims to identify any potential red flags or areas of concern that may require further investigation. The data coverage of 6 financial years provides a comprehensive overview of the council's spending trends and patterns.

The spending data is published under the Local Government Transparency Code, which ensures that the data is accurate and reliable. The code requires local authorities to publish their spending data regularly, providing citizens with access to information on how their tax money is being spent.

Analysis of Spending Patterns

The analysis of the spending data revealed that the council's spending patterns are complex and varied. With a total spend of £1732.6M, the council's spending is significant, and it is essential to ensure that the funds are being used efficiently and effectively. The data shows that the council has recorded 492,973 transactions during the 6-year period, indicating a high volume of spending activity.

Since there are no unique suppliers mentioned in the data brief, we cannot provide a comparison of the top suppliers. However, the total spend of £1732.6M can be broken down into various categories, such as departmental spend or spend by financial year. For example, the council's spending can be analysed by department, with each department having its own budget and spending patterns.

A detailed analysis of the spending data can help identify areas where the council can improve its spending efficiency and effectiveness. By examining the data, AI DOGE can provide recommendations for the council to optimise its spending and ensure that the funds are being used for the benefit of the citizens.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council about their spending patterns and trends.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to stay informed about the council's spending decisions and plans.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to access information on the council's contracts and spending agreements.
  • Write to your local councillor about any concerns you may have regarding the council's spending habits or patterns.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and gain a deeper understanding of the council's spending trends and patterns.
This article is based on Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council's published spending data covering 2020/21 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
